metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9760 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in WeeChat before 2.7.1 (0.3.4 to 2.7 are affected). When a new IRC message 005 is received with longer nick prefixes, a buffer overflow and possibly a crash can happen when a new mode is set for a nick.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 3.6-1
weechat-core - 3.6-1
weechat-curses - 3.6-1
weechat-guile - 3.6-1
weechat-headless - 3.6-1
weechat-lua - 3.6-1
weechat-perl - 3.6-1
weechat-php - 3.6-1
weechat-plugins - 3.6-1
weechat-python - 3.6-1
weechat-ruby - 3.6-1
weechat-tcl - 3.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: weechat package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6-1').
